what: Provide the account of your station
title: Example of WISP.data functions
code: userid <- Sys.getenv("WISP_IREA_USERID") pwd <- Sys.getenv("WISP_IREA_PSW")

what: Get data from the WISP station server for a multiple dates
title: Example of WISP.data functions
text: want download data single date, consider using function wisp_get_reflectance_data() instead.
code: reflect_data <- WISP.data::wisp_get_reflectance_multi_data(   time_from = "2024-04-08T09:00",   time_to = "2024-04-10T14:00",   station = "WISPstation012",   userid = userid,   pwd = pwd )

what: Quality Check (QC) and Sunglint Removal (SR) of the reflectance data
title: Example of WISP.data functions
code: reflect_data_qc <- WISP.data::wisp_qc_reflectance_data(   data = reflect_data,   maxPeak = 0.05 ) ##  ## ---- ## 9 spectral signatures were removed during QC: ## The spectral signature of 2024-04-08 10:45:05 has been removed thanks to QC2. It removes lines with outliers in the NIR (840 nm > 700 nm). ## The spectral signature of 2024-04-08 11:00:05 has been removed thanks to QC2. It removes lines with outliers in the NIR (840 nm > 700 nm). ## The spectral signature of 2024-04-08 11:15:05 has been removed thanks to QC2. It removes lines with outliers in the NIR (840 nm > 700 nm). ## The spectral signature of 2024-04-08 11:30:05 has been removed thanks to QC2. It removes lines with outliers in the NIR (840 nm > 700 nm). ## The spectral signature of 2024-04-08 13:00:04 has been removed thanks to QC1. It removes lines where the values are negative and below 845 nm. ## The spectral signature of 2024-04-08 13:15:05 has been removed thanks to QC1. It removes lines where the values are negative and below 845 nm. ## The spectral signature of 2024-04-08 13:30:05 has been removed thanks to QC1. It removes lines where the values are negative and below 845 nm. ## The spectral signature of 2024-04-08 13:45:04 has been removed thanks to QC1. It removes lines where the values are negative and below 845 nm. ## The spectral signature of 2024-04-10 13:45:05 has been removed thanks to QC1. It removes lines where the values are negative and below 845 nm. ## ---- reflect_data_sr <- WISP.data::wisp_sr_reflectance_data(   qc_data = reflect_data_qc )

title: Example of WISP.data functions
code: WISP.data::wisp_plot_reflectance_data(data = reflect_data_sr)

what: Quality Control (QC) for WISPstation reflectance data — qc_reflectance_data
title: Quality Control (QC) for WISPstation reflectance data — qc_reflectance_data
text: function removes anomalous spectral signatures explains reason elimination

title: Quality Control (QC) for WISPstation reflectance data — qc_reflectance_data
code: qc_reflectance_data(data, maxPeak = 0.05)

title: Quality Control (QC) for WISPstation reflectance data — qc_reflectance_data
text: data tibble. wisp_get_reflectance_data() function. maxPeak decimal. Maximum magnitude spectral signatures. recommend setting parameter : 0.02 clear oligotrophic water, 0.05 meso- eutrophic water, 0.08 hypereutrophic highly turbid water. #' Default 0.05.

title: Quality Control (QC) for WISPstation reflectance data — qc_reflectance_data
text: tibble spectral signatures passed QC operation. addition, message containing reason behind elimination anomalous spectral signature

title: Quality Control (QC) for WISPstation reflectance data — qc_reflectance_data
text: Alessandro Oggioni, phD alessandro.oggioni@cnr.Nicola Ghirardi, phD nicola.ghirardi@cnr.

what: Get data of reflectance (level2) from WISPstation for a specific multiple dates — wisp_get_data_dates
title: Get data of reflectance (level2) from WISPstation for a specific multiple dates — wisp_get_data_dates
text: function obtains data reflectance WISPstation multiple dates.

title: Get data of reflectance (level2) from WISPstation for a specific multiple dates — wisp_get_data_dates
code: wisp_get_data_dates(   version = "1.0",   time_from = NULL,   time_to = NULL,   station = NULL,   userid = NULL,   pwd = NULL )

title: Get data of reflectance (level2) from WISPstation for a specific multiple dates — wisp_get_data_dates
text: version character. version API data. Default "1.0" time_from character. date time data requested. time_to character. date time data requested. station character.  name station. userid character. userid access data service. pwd character. password access data service.

title: Get data of reflectance (level2) from WISPstation for a specific multiple dates — wisp_get_data_dates
text: tibble measurement id, measurement date, instrument name, waterquality values TSM, Chla Kd provided instrument default, values reflectance wevelength 350 900 nm, also label ... (e.g. EdF, LuS, LuP) means ... . Default 0.05.

title: Get data of reflectance (level2) from WISPstation for a specific multiple dates — wisp_get_data_dates
text: Alessandro Oggioni, phD alessandro.oggioni@cnr.

code: # example code if (FALSE) { ## Not run: # NA data reflect_data_multiDates <- wisp_get_data_dates(   time_from = "2024-04-08T09:00",   time_to = "2024-04-10T14:00",   station = "WISPstation012",   userid = userid,   pwd = pwd ) } ## End (Not run)

title: Get data of reflectance (level2) from WISPstation for a specific date — wisp_get_reflectance_data
text: version character. version API data. Default "1.0" time_from character. date time data requested. time_to character. date time data requested. station character.  name station. userid character. userid access data service. pwd character. password access data service.

title: Get data of reflectance (level2) from WISPstation for a specific date — wisp_get_reflectance_data
text: tibble measurement id, measurement date, instrument name, level2_quality, set sensor (irradiance radiances), waterquality values TSM, Chla, Kd, cpc provided instrument default, values reflectance wevelength 350 900 nm.

title: Get data of reflectance (level2) from WISPstation for a specific date — wisp_get_reflectance_data
text: Alessandro Oggioni, phD alessandro.oggioni@cnr.Nicola Ghirardi, phD nicola.ghirardi@cnr.

title: Get data of reflectance (level2) from WISPstation for a specific date — wisp_get_reflectance_data
code: # example code if (FALSE) { ## Not run: # NA data reflect_data <- WISP.data::wisp_get_reflectance_data(   time_from = "2024-09-01T09:00",   time_to = "2024-09-01T14:00",   station = "WISPstation012",   userid = userid,   pwd = pwd )  # with data reflect_data <- WISP.data::wisp_get_reflectance_data(   time_from = "2024-08-01T09:00",   time_to = "2024-08-01T14:00",   station = "WISPstation012",   userid = userid,   pwd = pwd )  # no data for the station selected reflect_data <- WISP.data::wisp_get_reflectance_data(   time_from = "2019-06-20T09:00",   time_to = "2019-06-20T14:00",   station = "WISPstation012",   userid = userid,   pwd = pwd )  # The two dates are not consistent reflect_data <- WISP.data::wisp_get_reflectance_data(   time_from = "2019-06-20T09:00",   time_to = "2020-06-20T14:00",   station = "WISPstation012",   userid = userid,   pwd = pwd ) } ## End (Not run)
